content: faded beanie by savannah owens does anyone have leftover fade colors that are just sitting in your yarn cabinet i do i loved my fade so much i couldn t bear the thought of all that beautiful yarn just sitting there so i created the faded beanie use your leftover yarns or even create a fade using mini skeins supplies fingering weight yarn i used a 6 color fade for this project yarn used evil little goat squishy goat 437 yards/100 grams color a brighton rock 25 grams color b you re my best friend 10 grams color c fat bottomed girls 10 grams color d save me 10 grams color e play the game 10 grams color f the hero 10 grams recommended needles size us 2 1/2 3 0 mm for brim and us 4 3 5 mm for body of hat helpful videos provisional cast on https //www youtube com/watch v=3ogg0aij3xe connecting provisional cast-on hem https //www youtube com/watch v=sd1oj7twzhi rolled hem with smaller needles using the provisional cast on method co 136 sts in color a join in the round knit 20 rounds purl 1 round knit 20 rounds rolling the hem i recommend using a spare needle to pick up the stitches from the provisional cast on first next fold the knitting to where the purl sides are facing each other the spare needle should be on the inside of the hat and the working needle on the outside the purl round should be at the bottom of this fold giving the fold a nice edge next round *knit 1st stitch on outside needle with 1st stich on inside needle* continue doing this across entire round until all stitches on spare needle have been knit together with the stitches from the working needle fading sequence tip i didn t worry about my stripes creating a jog since i was fading yarns there are several different methods to jogless knitting but i don t think it s necessary for this project with larger needles a- knit 6 rounds b- knit 2 rounds a- knit 2 rounds b- knit 2 rounds a- knit 2 rounds b- knit 6 rounds c- knit 2 rounds b- knit 2 rounds c- knit 2 rounds b- knit 2 rounds c-
